title.narrative: 6.1 CP SYSTEMS STRENGTHENED

description.narrative: 6.1 By 2019 relevant Government MDAs, Local Councils & communities have capacity to provide an inclusive and integrated child protection system as defined in the child welfare policy for the prevention of and response to violence, abuse and exploitation against boys and girls by 2018, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Human Rights Institutions, Justice For Children, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 6.0 Improved and equitable prevention of and response to violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect of children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 6.1 By 2019 relevant Government MDAs, Local Councils & communities have capacity to provide an inclusive and integrated child protection system as defined in the child welfare policy for the prevention of and response to violence, abuse and exploitation against boys and girls by 2018

description.narrative: Ministry of Social Welfare, Gender and Children's Affairs' Capacity Gap Analysis being finalized, and a Human Resource Strategic Plan being developed to support increased capacity among government Ministries, Departments and Agencies to implement an integrated child protection system. A costed Implementation Plan for the Child Welfare Policy was completed; and a standardized social work curriculum and diploma was created, thus contributing to the strengthening of capacity within the Ministry. A total of 11,895 children (5,124 boys; 6,771 girls) were provided with child protection services and care in 2019. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Degree of Development of the Quality Assurance System for Social Work

Country has a functioning, national, multi-sectoral, multi-stakeholder coordination mechanism tasked with overseeing national plans or strategies to prevent and respond to violence against children and adolescents, with child and adolescent participation.
Country has an inter-operable information management system supports and tracks case management, incident monitoring, and programme monitoring (all, including humanitarian)
